title: How to Clean Up Oil Spills

steps.title: Pick up pieces of glass.
steps.content: Pick up pieces of glass. Glass can be a problem if you dropped the bottle that contained the oil. If glass is present in the spill, use garden gloves or ice cube tongs to pick up the pieces. Cover the glass in newspaper before putting it in the trashcan. Wear shoes with rubber soles while cleaning up the glass.

steps.title: Cover the area with an absorbent material.
steps.content: Cover the area with an absorbent material. You can use salt, kitty litter, corn starch, sand, or oatmeal as the absorbent material. Pour the material over the entirety of the spill. Allow the material to sit on the spill for about fifteen minutes. [1] X Research source You can blot up some of the spill with paper towels before applying the absorbent material. You won’t need as much material if you blot up the spill first.

steps.title: Scoop up the absorbent material.
steps.content: Scoop up the absorbent material. You can use paper towels or a spatula to do this. Do not use a vacuum cleaner or mop at this point. Continue to scoop up the material until the absorbent material and oil is gone.

steps.title: Wipe up the leftover residue.
steps.content: Wipe up the leftover residue. Use paper towels or slices of bread to wipe up the oil residue. You should be able to remove most of the residue. Don’t worry if the floor is slightly sticky when you’ve removed most of the residue.

steps.title: Mop up the floor.
steps.content: Mop up the floor. Use a grease-fighting dish detergent when you mop. Combine the detergent with warm water. Go over the area where the spill was until the floor is clean and free of residue.

steps.title: Pour dish detergent on the spill.
steps.content: Pour dish detergent on the spill. You can blot up some of the oil with paper towels to begin before using the detergent. Use a grease-fighting dish detergent. Squirt a liberal amount of the detergent over the spill.

steps.title: Scrub the area.
steps.content: Scrub the area. Apply some water and begin to scrub the area. If the floor hasn’t been stained yet, you can use a cleaning brush. If some staining has occurred, use a rag. Scrub gently to avoid scratching the floor.

steps.title: Apply more soap and water.
steps.content: Apply more soap and water. You will probably have to apply more soap and water as you scrub up the oil paint. Do not use a lot of water when you apply more to the spill. Only apply about four tablespoons of water. Continue to scrub until the floor becomes clean and shiny. You may have to scrub for a while for the spill to lift completely.

steps.title: Sprinkle powder over the spill.
steps.content: Sprinkle powder over the spill. You can use baby powder or talcum powder. Use cat litter if the spill is large. Spread the powder over the spill with a broom. Allow it to sit overnight. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Use a concrete cleaner or strong degreaser, as an alternative.
steps.content: Use a concrete cleaner or strong degreaser, as an alternative. You can find cleaners formulated for use on concrete, including some formulated to treat oil or grease. Alkaline cleaners are especially helpful for cleaning up this kind of spill. [3] X Research source Use the concrete cleaner or degreaser as an alternative to powder, not in addition to it.

steps.title: Sweep up the residue.
steps.content: Sweep up the residue. Use a broom to sweep up the powder after you have let it sit overnight. Most of the oil should have been absorbed at this point. You can use paper towels to blot up remaining residue. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Wash with detergent.
steps.content: Wash with detergent. You can use grease-fighting dish detergent, or you can use laundry detergent. Combine the detergent with hot water. You can let the detergent sit on the spill for about an hour if residue remains. Use a mop or a cleaning brush to wash the area.

steps.title: Rinse with hot water.
steps.content: Rinse with hot water. Use warm water to rinse off the detergent and remaining oil. The concrete should be clean at this point. You can repeat the process if any oil remains.

steps.title: Take preventative measures.
steps.content: Take preventative measures. Drilling is one large factor that contributes to oil spills. Contact legislators in your state and ask them to vote for bills that ban drilling and any other environmentally friendly policies. You can also sign petitions calling for your state representatives to sign environmentally friendly bills. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Volunteer your help.
steps.content: Volunteer your help. Google “oil spill volunteers” to see what organizations are asking for volunteers. Call the organization and ask how you can help. In some instances, like caring for animals, only qualified professionals will be able to help. For other volunteering opportunities, like administrative help, volunteers may have to be trained. Untrained volunteering opportunities, like picking up trash, should be abundantly available. [6] X Research source Do not try to help wildlife unless you have the permission and knowledge to do so. [7] X Research source The Audubon Society, which protects birds and their habitats, is one place that you can contact for volunteering opportunities.

steps.title: Report injuries and damage.
steps.content: Report injuries and damage. If you are in the area where the oil spill occurred, call the local authorities to report injuries and damage that you feel has gone unnoticed. It is likely that there will be a hotline specifically for injured and dead animal sightings, but it will change depending on the event and location. Do not try to help injured animals unless you are qualified to do so. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Donate to organizations.
steps.content: Donate to organizations. In some cases, a donation is more helpful and preferred over volunteering. A couple of places you can donate to are the National Wildlife Federation and the Save Our Seabirds organization. During oil spills, companies like Dawn will donate a portion of your purchase to help the clean up effort. [9] X Research source
